## Purpose
Main entry point module for the Rich library, providing global console management and convenience functions for terminal-based rich text formatting. Acts as a facade over the core Console functionality with singleton pattern for global console access.

## Key Functions

### Global Console Management
- **get_console() (L23-36)**: Singleton factory returning global Console instance. Lazy-initializes _console on first call.
- **reconfigure(*args, **kwargs) (L39-50)**: Replaces global console configuration by creating new Console and copying its __dict__ to existing instance.

### Convenience Print Functions  
- **print(*objects, sep=" ", end="\n", file=None, flush=False) (L53-74)**: Drop-in replacement for built-in print() using Rich formatting. Uses global console for stdout, creates new Console for custom files.
- **print_json(json=None, *, data=None, indent=2, ...) (L77-117)**: Pretty-prints JSON with syntax highlighting and formatting options. Delegates to console.print_json().
- **inspect(obj, *, console=None, title=None, help=False, ...) (L120-173)**: Object introspection with rich formatting. Special handling for self-inspection (L159). Uses provided console or falls back to global.

## Global State
- **_console (L14)**: Optional global Console instance, initialized lazily
- **_IMPORT_CWD (L16-20)**: Captures current working directory at import time with FileNotFoundError handling

## Dependencies
- Core dependency on `pip._vendor.rich.console.Console` (imported locally in functions)
- Uses `pip._vendor.rich._inspect.Inspect` for object introspection
- IPython extension support via `._extension.load_ipython_extension` (L6)

## Architectural Patterns
- **Singleton pattern**: Global console managed via module-level variable
- **Lazy initialization**: Console created only when first accessed
- **Facade pattern**: Simplifies Rich library usage with convenience functions
- **Local imports**: Console imported within functions to avoid circular dependencies

## Critical Invariants
- Global console state is shared across all module-level print operations
- File-specific printing bypasses global console and creates dedicated instances
- Reconfigure operation preserves object identity while replacing internal state
